diff_hunk:
@@ -48,8 +48,11 @@ const char kUsageHeader[] =
     "through\n"
     "the 'org.tensorflow.op.Ops' API as a group until the generated classes "
     "are compiled using an appropriate annotation processor.\n\n"
-    "Finally, the '--base_package' overrides the default parent package "
-    "under which the generated subpackage and classes are to be located.\n\n";
+    "The '--base_package' overrides the default parent package under which "
+    "the generated subpackage and classes are to be located.\n\n"
+    "Finally, a list of directories of API proto definitions can be provided "
body:
You're not wrong in that those aren't present yet.
But we should add them and use that mechanism to organize instead of lib names.
The Python API is organized like that with ApiDef overrides, for example: [1](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/api_def/python_api/api_def_DecodeJpeg.pbtxt), [2](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/api_def/python_api/api_def_BatchMatrixTriangularSolve.pbtxt), [3](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/api_def/python_api/api_def_RightShift.pbtxt) etc.
body_html:
You're not wrong in that those aren't present yet.
But we should add them and use that mechanism to organize instead of lib names.
The Python API is organized like that with ApiDef overrides, for example: 1, 2, 3 etc.
